top_categories.workout_context: Trans Iowa’s 320-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
At 320 miles, Trans Iowa rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Racing Trans Iowa isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Every session at Trans Iowa intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Trans Iowa’s iowa farmland, rolling gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Trans Iowa’s iowa rolling farmland gravel delivers on race day.
Trans Iowa’s iowa rolling farmland gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Trans Iowa rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Trans Iowa when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Trans Iowa — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Trans Iowa’s 9,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Trans Iowa. Make this intensity feel like home.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 320 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 320 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Trans Iowa requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on iowa rolling farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: iowa farmland, rolling gravel, 300+ mile distance.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, HVLI Extended, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 320 miles of iowa rolling farmland gravel in Checkpoint, Iowa.
